mathlib3D
Class Matrix3D

java.lang.Object
  mathlib3D.Matrix3D
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class Matrix3D
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

Defines a 3D (4x4) matrix for general transformations. Elements of the matrix are type double and are stored at (row,col) locations whose index values start at zero. Modeled loosely after the Java 2D "AffineTransform" class.

Version:
4.8 02/22/06, 4.9 02/23/07 Added angle/axis constructor
Author:
William Dimaculangan, John Clevenger
See Also:
Serialized Form

          Creates a new Matrix3D containing the rotation transformation equivalent to a rotation of the specified angle (in degrees) about the specified axis.

Constructor Detail

Matrix3D

public Matrix3D()
Creates a Matrix3D initialized to the identity matrix

Matrix3D

public Matrix3D(double[] values)
Creates a Matrix3D containing the contents specified by the given 'values' array. The first four elements of 'values' are taken to be column 0, the second four are column one, etc. The input array is assumed to contain exactly 16 elements; otherwise, an error message is displayed and an unspecified result is returned.

Matrix3D

public Matrix3D(double angleInDegrees,
                Vector3D axis)
Creates a new Matrix3D containing the rotation transformation equivalent to a rotation of the specified angle (in degrees) about the specified axis.

Method Detail

elementAt

public double elementAt(int row,
                        int col)
Returns the element stored in this matrix at the specified location.

setElementAt

public void setElementAt(int row,
                         int col,
                         double value)
Sets the element stored in this matrix at the specified location to the specified value.

getRow

public Vector3D getRow(int row)
Returns a Vector3D containing in its XYZW fields the values currently stored in the specified row (0,1,2, or 3) of this matrix.

getCol

public Vector3D getCol(int col)
Returns a Vector3D containing in its XYZW fields the values currently stored in the specified column (0,1,2, or 3) of this matrix.

setRow

public void setRow(int row,
                   Vector3D vector)
Sets the specified row of this matrix to the XYZW values of the specified vector.

setCol

public void setCol(int col,
                   Vector3D vector)
Sets the specified column of this matrix to the XYZW values of the specified vector.

getValues

public double[] getValues()
Returns a 1-dimensional array containing the elements of this Matrix3D extracted in column order. That is, the first element (element zero) of the returned array contains the Matrix3D value at column zero, row zero; the second element contains the Matrix3D value at column zero, row one, etc.

setValues

public void setValues(double[] newValues)
Loads the elements of this Matrix3D from a 16-element 1-dimensional array containing the elements arranged in column order. That is, the first element (element zero) of the specified array is stored the Matrix3D at column zero, row zero; the second element is stored in the Matrix3D at column zero, row one, etc.

concatenate

public void concatenate(Matrix3D matrix2)
Concatenates a second matrix onto this matrix on the right. That is, multiplies this matrix by the specified matrix, with the result [thisMatrix] = [thisMatrix] x [matrix2].

scale

public void scale(double sx,
                  double sy,
                  double sz)
Concatentates a scaling transformation onto this matrix. Calling this method is equivalent to calling concatentate(S) where S is a Matrix3D with the specified X,Y,Z scaling factors in the main diagonal.

translate

public void translate(double tx,
                      double ty,
                      double tz)
Concatentates a translation onto this matrix. Calling this method is equivalent to calling concatentate(T) where T is a Matrix3D with the specified X,Y,Z translation factors in rows 0, 1, and 2 of column 3.

rotate

public void rotate(double xAngle,
                   double yAngle,
                   double zAngle)
Concatenates onto this matrix a rotation about the X, Y, and Z axes by the specified angles, which are assumed to be in radians. The specified rotations are put into the matrix such that they are effectively performed in the order Y, then X, then Z.

rotateX

public void rotateX(double theta)
Concatenates a rotation about the X axis by amount theta onto this matrix; theta is specified in radians. Calling this method is equivalent to calling concatentate(R) where R is a Matrix3D with the specified rotation factor theta about the X axis.

rotateY

public void rotateY(double theta)
Concatenates a rotation about the Y axis by amount theta onto this matrix; theta is specified in radians. Calling this method is equivalent to calling concatentate(R) where R is a Matrix3D with the specified rotation factor theta about the Y axis.

rotateZ

public void rotateZ(double theta)
Concatenates a rotation about the Z axis by amount theta onto this matrix; theta is specified in radians. Calling this method is equivalent to calling concatentate(R) where R is a Matrix3D with the specified rotation factor theta about the Z axis.

setToIdentity

public void setToIdentity()
Initializes this matrix to the identity matrix.

inverse

public Matrix3D inverse()
Returns a new Matrix3D which is the inverse of this Matrix3D. Uses a javax.vecmath "matrix4d" (4x4 matrix of doubles) containing the same values as this Matrix3D to create the inverse Does not alter the contents of this matrix.

transpose

public Matrix3D transpose()
Returns a new Matrix3D which is the transpose of this Matrix3D. Does not alter the contents of this matrix.

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Returns a printable representation of the contents of this matrix, formatted into row and columns via embedded newlines.

Overrides:
